document_title: Interstitial cystitis: Causes, symptoms and treatment
subsection_name: viem-bang-quang-ke.json_7_How to prevent interstitial cystitis after treatment
subsection_content:
Interstitial cystitis is considered a chronic disease. Although it is very difficult for the patient to completely recover, the disease can still be controlled and improved to alleviate symptoms and stabilize urinary health.
Changing a healthy lifestyle is a leading method to help you control and improve your disease after receiving treatment. Besides, for patients who are being treated for interstitial cystitis,  you also need to combine this method to optimize results after treatment.
Some common activities that you need to keep in mind to improve interstitial cystitis:
Drink enough water; Limit eating foods high in potassium such as caffeine, chocolate, tomatoes; Limit or stop smoking; Exercise or physical therapy specifically for people with interstitial cystitis
Interstitial cystitis is a chronic disease that causes pelvic pain and bladder tightness. Not only physical pain, the disease also causes inconvenience in daily activities when people with cystitis have symptoms of urinary urgency, urgency, and urinary incontinence. To effectively prevent interstitial cystitis, you need to understand what interstitial cystitis is, its causes, and treatment methods.

For people with interstitial cystitis, you need to understand the condition as well as the outbreak cycle to take appropriate treatment measures to maintain stable urinary health. In addition, patients also need to be careful during treatment and follow instructions from specialists to limit bad risks and increase the possibility of improving urinary health.
